content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #86276 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

I was wavering on whether to request prioritization for this issue, given that it's a bug with a nightly-only feature, but I ended up deciding to request prioritization because, even though the feature is unstable, the bug is visible to stable users (because std::ptr::addr_of! is stable), and I figure it's better to err on the side of prioritizing.
Oh I missed your comment here. I'll add back I-prioritize.

@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #86276 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

I think this is P-low because it doesn't matter to downstream users whether it's implemented as macro_rules or not, so it doesn't matter that it's visible on stable. I would be open to reconsidering when macros 2.0 are stabilized but that's a long way away.
P-low is often used to mean "won't fix" though.
My understanding is that P-low is "we won't fix this, but if you want to submit a PR you're welcome to."
I think I'd personally call this a P-medium, but I don't think P-low is unreasonable either.
We should try to come to a decision on this?
I trust Joshua's call on this (and he's in t-rustdoc), this nightly-only annoyance is relatively important now (also it's on Noah Lev's radar)
Is rustbot down or why is the label not applied?

Stu said:

Is rustbot down or why is the label not applied?

ugh -_- ... it's happening again. last week was github faults'. I don't know what's wrong this time, also yesterday the bot was not responding
